NAME: Ciel Bleu
REVIEW:
Ciel Bleu immediately lives up to its name. Here, you dine on the top floor of the luxurious Okura Hotel with a spectacular view of the blue sky and the Amsterdam skyline as a backdrop. The modern elegance of the restaurant and the superlative presentation of the dishes are equally pleasing to the eye.
Arjan Speelman's cuisine is technically accomplished, creative and laced with international influences and seasonings. This chef effortlessly combines a classic beurre blanc with exotic spices and ingredients from around the globe. Every detail is precise, every bite a surprise. A nice touch: with each course, a herb in its original form is brought to the table – this herb will be featured in the next dish.
Dining at Ciel Bleu is intriguing. You will be served by one of the best front-of-house teams in the country, starring sommelier Noël Vanwittenbergh and maître d' Francesco Simonelli. The sky really is the limit here!
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Car park,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Diners Club credit card,Great view,Mastercard credit card,Particularly interesting wine list,Valet parking,Visa credit card

NAME: Spectrum
REVIEW:
Sidney Schutte's spectrum of flavours is astonishing. At De Librije, he developed his own inventive culinary style, and at Amber (Hong Kong) he mastered the sophisticated techniques particular to Asian cuisine. His food looks as spectacular as it tastes – exciting and colourful with a unique interplay of textures.
First-class Dutch produce and international seasonings come together here in complex dishes. The technically gifted chef does not shy away from contrasts, and he is certainly an innovator rather than an imitator! This applies to his vegetarian set menu as well as to his fish and meat creations. His combination of crispy duck tongue, blue lobster and foie gras with liquorice and green apple is simply amazing. At Spectrum, every bite creates a new impression that increases the desire for more.
This typical canal house enchants visitors with its understated class and beautiful elegance. The extremely attentive service comes courtesy of the highly accomplished front-of-house team. A real fine dining experience!
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Particularly interesting wine list,Restaurant offering vegetarian menus,Valet parking,Visa credit card

NAME: Restaurant 212
REVIEW: The open-plan kitchen has a central place in this modern restaurant where guests enjoy interacting with the chefs from the seats at the counter. Here you can watch Richard van Oostenbrugge and Thomas Groot working with delicate precision, preparing inventive and creative dishes which surprise diners with their unexpectedly striking flavours.
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Particularly interesting wine list,Visa credit card

NAME: Flore
REVIEW: Bas van Kranen showcases his culinary ideas at Flore (formerly Bord’Eau), where nature adds plenty of character to the interior and the view of the canal remains as unique as ever. This talented chef has a resolute focus on organic and local ingredients, resulting in a “conscious fine dining” concept that is clearly evident in creative and highly personal dishes. Here, original techniques, pure flavours and lots of passion combine to create a captivating spectacle!
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Restaurant offering vegetarian menus,Valet parking,Visa credit card,Wheelchair access

NAME: Sinne
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card

NAME: RON Gastrobar
REVIEW:
Ron Blaauw is something of a culinary mastermind. In 2013, the popular chef transformed his two-MICHELIN-starred restaurant into this down-to-earth gastrobar, and it was an instant success. This hip urban establishment offers a diverse atmosphere in which to discover chef Blaauw's relaxed fine dining concept.
Eschewing any unnecessary frills, the focus lies squarely on original combinations and distinct flavours. Here, you can enjoy simple yet imaginative cuisine that is intelligent, elaborate and bold. Think veal sweetbreads cooked in time-honoured tradition, a spicy blend of lentils, textures of pumpkin and yoghurt with lime zest for body and freshness. The dishes here are brimming with flavour.
The impressive menu features classics such as beef Wellington, vegetarian options and premium produce such as wagyu and turbot cooked on the barbecue, as well as an amazing onion Martini (with a Comté foam). You will likely want to order the lot! At Ron Gastrobar, the flavours of the Amsterdam metropolis come alive.
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Counter dining,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Restaurant offering vegetarian menus,Terrace,Visa credit card

NAME: Bolenius
REVIEW:
Luc Kusters is an ambassador of Dutch cuisine who lays the focus squarely on vegetables and local produce. On a daily basis, he harvests delicious produce from his kitchen garden, located close to the restaurant in the Zuidas business district! Bolenius's elegant minimalist style and urban vibe reflect the purity of the cuisine. The ethos behind this sustainable vision is regularly explained when the kitchen team serve their dishes themselves.
The head chef's ingenuity comes to the fore in the stunning presentation and flavour combinations of his dishes. His cuisine is light but brimming with intensity. He prefers to express himself with vegetables and herbs – beetroot grown in clay soil with morels is a signature dish for good reason – but he also works with meat and fish, eg Dutch Kamper lamb or pike-perch from the North Sea. Whether you opt for his plant-based set menu or the "Dutch Menu" (also available à la carte), the versatility and nuances he draws out of treasures from Dutch soil is uncommonly captivating: aromatic cauliflower, green peppers and textures of buckwheat with a clear broth that brings everything together and adds depth. The way chef Kusters turns 'simplicity' into memorable cuisine is truly remarkable.
FacilitiesAndServices: American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Particularly interesting wine list,Restaurant offering vegetarian menus,Terrace,Visa credit card

NAME: Yamazato
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Car park,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Diners Club credit card,Mastercard credit card,Particularly interesting wine list,Valet parking,Visa credit card

NAME: RIJKS®
FacilitiesAndServices: American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Restaurant offering vegetarian menus,Terrace,Visa credit card,Wheelchair access

NAME: Lastage
REVIEW: Lastage is an appealing little restaurant which will immediately make you feel welcome. Chef Van Dam delights the taste buds with dishes that are full of personality. Nothing on the plate is unnecessary – every ingredient adds interest and is there to enhance the dish. For the quality, the prices are more than reasonable. This is a little establishment with big flavours!
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card

NAME: Vinkeles
REVIEW:
The stylish Vinkeles is housed in what was once the bakery of an 18C Roman Catholic almshouse. Wooden and stone remnants merge seamlessly with tasteful contemporary comfort. This unique setting inspires Jurgen van der Zalm to create contemporary cuisine with an eye for detail.
The talented chef brings classic culinary know-how, international influences, playfulness and exciting creativity to the table. If you order the Anjou pigeon or the turbot, you can be sure that it will be cooked to perfection and that the sauces will be intense and delicate. The goose liver gratinated with 100% chocolate and served with an almond crème caramel demonstrates that he also masters modern techniques.
The balance between the two is always carefully maintained by Jurgen van der Zalm, who cooks with respect for the work of Dennis Kuipers, who used to be head chef here. It makes for dishes that are both heart-warming and surprising. Vinkeles offers the best of both worlds and will keep you coming back for more.
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Diners Club credit card,Mastercard credit card,Restaurant offering vegetarian menus,Visa credit card

NAME: THE DUCHESS
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card

NAME: The White Room by Jacob Jan Boerma
REVIEW: You can imagine yourself as an Austrian prince or princess in this white and gold dining room, which dates from 1885 and magnificently combines classical elegance with modern furnishings. Citrus flavours and exotic spices are combined in a creative interplay. The chef is a strong technician and understands what refinement really means.
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Diners Club credit card,Mastercard credit card,Restaurant offering vegetarian menus,Valet parking,Visa credit card,Wheelchair access

NAME: MOS
REVIEW: The interior is relaxed and chic, the large windows offer a fantastic view of the IJ river, and the food is delicious. MOS is sublime. The chef shows how a little creativity conjures up a variety of prominent flavours, producing balanced combinations that are both rich and refined. Guests are advised to ask about parking when reserving.
FacilitiesAndServices: American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Terrace,Visa credit card

NAME: Bougainville
REVIEW:
In Bougainville, a top-class fine dining experience awaits you. Warm fabrics, luxurious design and bronze tones come together in a setting that is intimate and romantic. The contrast with the features of this historical building is indeed something to behold, and the magnificent view of Dam Square is equally remarkable. Tim Golsteijn's cuisine is in keeping with the sophisticated surroundings.
He marries flavours from East and West with a creativity that is all his own. For this chef, technical skill and culinary instinct go hand in hand. He effortlessly balances the intensity of ingredients such as Thai green curry and za'atar spices with delicate French aromas. Chef Golsteijn does not shy away from daring combinations, but always ensures that the flavours enhance each other. A fine example of this is the perfectly pan-seared foie gras served with a Madeira wine jus and frozen raspberry pearls. An interplay of flavours, textures and temperatures that you won't be able to get enough of!
Every visit to Bougainville brings a fascinating discovery. And it is made all the more exciting by the sommelier's amazing discoveries.
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Particularly interesting wine list,Restaurant offering vegetarian menus,Valet parking,Visa credit card

NAME: Graphite by Peter Gast
REVIEW: Take the QR code you are given when you make your reservation, go to Paardenstraat and look for the door with a scanner, which leads to this mysterious speakeasy restaurant. After a drink in the cocktail bar, head for the intimate and discreet dining room, where Peter Gast combines traditional techniques with inventive ideas, applying his technical ability and know-how with plenty of feeling. Intriguing!
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Restaurant offering vegetarian menus,Visa credit card

NAME: De Kas
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Garden or park,Great view,Mastercard credit card,Restaurant offering vegetarian menus,Terrace,Visa credit card

NAME: Le Restaurant
REVIEW: Le Restaurant is as diverse and lively as its surrounding De Pijp neighbourhood. Don’t let the somewhat anonymous façade fool you as inside you will find a cosy restaurant with an informal bistro feel. Jan de Wit's formula for success remains the same: a simple but spectacular menu. The best of market produce is prepared without too much fuss and plated up in its authentic form to convince diners with its powerful flavours. The price-pleasure ratio is spot on.
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card

NAME: Lars Amsterdam
REVIEW: Combining an industrial vibe with an intimate living room feel, Lars is situated at the end of the Houthavens and boasts stunning views across the water. In the kitchen, the ambitious Lars Scharp plays with French traditions and fresh Asian flavours to create bold contemporary dishes that are a world away from traditional cuisine.
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Terrace,Visa credit card

NAME: Wils
REVIEW: Buzzy, bright and bold, Wils, Amsterdam’s take on a brasserie, is both spacious and intimate. The cocktail bar is irresistibly trendy. Chef Bijdendijk and his team deploy their talent and skill to great effect and frequently offer vegetarian dishes. A culinary experience depicted by a felicitous chaos of flavours and textures. You will love this relaxed eatery!
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Counter dining,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Restaurant offering vegetarian menus,Terrace,Visa credit card,Wheelchair access

NAME: Zoldering
REVIEW: One chef and three wine-enthusiasts share their joie de vivre in this lively neighbourhood bistro, where you can enjoy a good glass of wine (one of the best selections in the city) and simple, unfussy cuisine (à la carte only). The restaurant delights guests with its modern take on French cuisine, in which ingredients are skilfully combined with original flair. Delightful!
FacilitiesAndServices: American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Particularly interesting wine list,Visa credit card

NAME: De Juwelier
REVIEW: Richard van Oostenbrugge and Thomas Groot’s retro-style bistro is full of character. Here, guests choose from an à la carte menu featuring lesser-known ingredients such as veal kidneys in dishes which are traditionally influenced yet also contemporary in style. An excellent restaurant in which to enjoy intensely flavoured sauces, top-quality ingredients and all the finesse of French cuisine.
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Counter dining,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card

NAME: Daalder
REVIEW: With its neon lighting, bold graphics, street art and night-club atmosphere, Daalder’s new home in Het Sieraad will leave a lasting impression. Here, the strong personality of Dennis Huwaë, who can be seen hard at work on his cooking platform, is evident in every detail, with his Indonesian roots and Asian influences feeding his creativity. Subtle, intense and occasionally complex cuisine that is always explosive. A fascinating culinary experience!
FacilitiesAndServices: American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Terrace,Visa credit card

NAME: Café Caron
REVIEW: This cosy bistro is run by Alain Caron (a well-known TV personality and chef) and his family. The ambience here is typically French, as is the menu which features traditional, generous bistro-style dishes which are a work of art in their own right. Trying out the à la carte here is a real joy.
FacilitiesAndServices: American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Restaurant offering vegetarian menus,Terrace,Visa credit card

NAME: Serre
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Car park,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Diners Club credit card,Mastercard credit card,Terrace,Valet parking,Visa credit card,Wheelchair access

NAME: Brasserie van Baerle
REVIEW: There is no getting around it: wine is part of the core business of this elegant, ever-inviting luxury brasserie. The impressive selection of wines by the glass and extensive drinks menu will impress even the most seasoned connoisseur. Classics from the brasserie repertoire are served up here with great attention to detail and a sense of generosity. The steak tartare is a real crowd pleaser.
FacilitiesAndServices: American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Particularly interesting wine list,Terrace,Visa credit card

NAME: Scheepskameel
FacilitiesAndServices: Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Restaurant offering vegetarian menus,Terrace,Visa credit card

NAME: A-Fusion
REVIEW: This intimate restaurant will entice you with its array of Chinese, Japanese, Thai and Korean dishes. On entering, you will see sushi being made to order, and as you go further in you will notice the barbecue and the dim sum and wok kitchen. Thanks to the reasonably priced à la carte menu and small dishes, you can try everything. Deep flavours, spices, umami, super fresh fish... a real gem of Asian cuisine!
FacilitiesAndServices: American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card

NAME: Umami by Han
REVIEW: Renowned chef Han Ji has created a recipe for success at Umami, a bright, contemporary restaurant in which he concocts high-flying Asian fusion cuisine. The range of tasting sensations is suitably impressive, ranging from sweet to savoury and crunchy and smooth in intense dishes full of flavour and colour. An irresistibly exotic experience!
FacilitiesAndServices: American Express credit card,Counter dining,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card

NAME: Marie
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Restaurant offering vegetarian menus,Terrace,Visa credit card

NAME: Domenica
REVIEW: Domenica’s outdoor terrace is the ideal place to sit and enjoy the lively atmosphere of the Jordaan district. This restaurant is popular with locals, who come here for the Mediterranean cuisine heavily influenced by Italy, featuring dishes such as traditional linguini with a delicious sauce or the restaurant’s own take on ceviche, all bursting with flavour. The owner has a real passion for wine, which he happily shares with guests.
FacilitiesAndServices: American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Diners Club credit card,Mastercard credit card,Terrace,Visa credit card

NAME: Arles
REVIEW: This attractive bistro brings a touch of Provence to Amsterdam, with framed photos of the chef's native city Arles adorning the walls. The chef, a fan of jazz music, creates neo-bistro-style dishes which offer a fresh reinterpretation of familiar French flavours. The fixed-price menu, which changes every month, is a real winner!
FacilitiesAndServices: Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Restaurant offering vegetarian menus,Terrace,Visa credit card

NAME: Auberge Jean & Marie
REVIEW: Whether you choose to go to the back of the restaurant to select your own bottle from the wine cellar or you ask Jan and Marije for their exceptional advice, you’ll be spoilt for choice in this delightfully informal restaurant which is perfect for wine lovers. Rich and tasty traditional French cuisine with the occasional contemporary twist accompanies these fine wines.
FacilitiesAndServices: American Express credit card,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Particularly interesting wine list,Terrace,Visa credit card

NAME: Rijsel
REVIEW: The interior of this lively establishment resembles a classroom, and indeed this building was once a home economics school. Today you can see the 'master' at work preparing his lesson in French gastronomy thanks to the open kitchen. He has a sound knowledge of his ingredients and incorporates a nod to Flemish cuisine into his no-nonsense dishes. Whether you order the intensely flavoured typical Southern French fish soup or côte de bœuf served with a house-made béarnaise sauce and fried potatoes: at Rijsel, every dish is a feast!
FacilitiesAndServices: Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Particularly interesting wine list,Visa credit card

NAME: Fa. Pekelhaaring
REVIEW: Welcome to the urban canteen of a number of Amsterdam’s local residents – a relaxed eatery without unnecessary sophistication, but one which is both authentic and welcoming. The cuisine is influenced (but not exclusively) by Italy and the chef enjoys adding his own variations and personal touches (such as crunchy textures and local influences) to his cooking. The varied à la carte is impressive indeed!
FacilitiesAndServices: Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Visa credit card

NAME: Oriole
REVIEW: Oriole is a peaceful haven amid the hustle and bustle of the city centre. The decor in this luxurious brasserie is truly splendid (especially the stunning bar), but a table on the terrace is a real must. This hidden treasure offers a contemporary version of Mediterranean flavours (with particular attention paid to vegetables), that matches the setting perfectly. Purity, finesse and passion combine here to create a festival of southern flavours.
FacilitiesAndServices: Air conditioning,Credit card / Debit card accepted,Mastercard credit card,Terrace,Visa credit card
